DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Crop Plant sample enhanced annotation checklist
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: ENA Crop Plant sample enhanced annotation checklist
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: The ENA Crop sample enhanced checklist has been developed in collaboration with a number of EMBL-EBI teams to capture enriched annotation of published crop plant samples that lack sufficient reported metadata and are typically associated with systematic transcriptomic realignment-based analyses.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Part and developmental stage of organism
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Anatomical and developmental descriptions of the sample site or source material

FIELD.LABEL: cell_type
FIELD.NAME: cell_type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: cell type from which the sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: dev_stage
FIELD.NAME: dev_stage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: if the sample was obtained from an organism in a specific developmental stage, it is specified with this qualifier

FIELD.LABEL: organism part
FIELD.NAME: organism part
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The part of organism's anatomy or substance arising from an organism from which the biomaterial was derived, excludes cells.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: infect
FIELD.NAME: infect
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the disease causing/contaminating organism; the value can also be ‘control’.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date the sample was collected with the intention of sequencing, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: (^[12][0-9]{3}(-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])(-(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?(/[0-9]{4}(-[0-9]{2}(-[0-9]{2}(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?)?$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of where the sample was collected from, with the intention of sequencing, as defined by the country or sea name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: sampling time point
FIELD.NAME: sampling time point
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Time point at which a sample or observation is made or taken from a biomaterial as measured from some reference point. Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format.

FIELD.LABEL: initial time point
FIELD.NAME: initial time point
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The first time point measured at the start of some process.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: sex
FIELD.NAME: sex
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: sex of the organism from which the sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: age
FIELD.NAME: age
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Age of the organism the sample was derived from.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: default

FIELD.LABEL: phenotype
FIELD.NAME: phenotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Where possible, please use the Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) to describe your phenotypes.

FIELD.LABEL: cellular component
FIELD.NAME: cellular component
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The part of a cell or its extracellular environment in which a gene product is located.

FIELD.LABEL: individual
FIELD.NAME: individual
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An individual used a specimen in an experiment, from which a material sample was derived.

FIELD.LABEL: disease staging
FIELD.NAME: disease staging
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The stage or progression of a disease in an organism. Includes pathological staging of cancers and other disease progression. E.g. Dukes C stage describing colon cancer (EFO_0000410).

FIELD.LABEL: immunoprecipitate
FIELD.NAME: immunoprecipitate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The precipitate antibody bound target molecules generated when precipitating an antigen out of a solution during the process of immunoprecipitation.

FIELD.LABEL: replicate
FIELD.NAME: replicate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A role played by a biological sample in the context of an experiment where the intent is that biological or technical variation is measured.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Infraspecies information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Formal and informal infraspecies taxonomic information

FIELD.LABEL: cultivar
FIELD.NAME: cultivar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: cultivar (cultivated variety) of plant from which sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: ecotype
FIELD.NAME: ecotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a population within a given species displaying genetically based, phenotypic traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat.

FIELD.LABEL: cell_line
FIELD.NAME: cell_line
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: cell line from which the sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: strain
FIELD.NAME: strain
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the strain from which the sample was obtained.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: treatment
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Details of a treatment regime with a treatment agent.

FIELD.LABEL: time
FIELD.NAME: time
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The duration in which the treatment has occurred.

FIELD.LABEL: dose
FIELD.NAME: dose
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total quantity or strength of a substance administered at one time.

FIELD.LABEL: chemical compound
FIELD.NAME: chemical compound
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A drug, solvent, chemical, etc., with a property that can be measured such as concentration (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/CHEBI_37577).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: experimental factor and block

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor 1
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor 1
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A variable that the experiment is based on.

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor 2
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor 2
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A variable that the experiment is based on.

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor 3
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor 3
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A variable that the experiment is based on.

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor 4
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor 4
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A variable that the experiment is based on.

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor 5
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor 5
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A variable that the experiment is based on.

FIELD.LABEL: block
FIELD.NAME: block
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A block or batch is an experimental unit arrangement into a group which is similar to one another. Typically, a blocking factor is a source of variability that is not of primary interest to the experimenter. An example of a blocking factor might be the sex of a patient; by blocking on sex, this source of variability is controlled for, thus leading to greater accuracy (EFO_0005067).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics: genetic
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: The genetic based characteristics of organisms (Organism characteristics field group became too large)

FIELD.LABEL: genotype
FIELD.NAME: genotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name or code for genotype of organism

FIELD.LABEL: genetic modification
FIELD.NAME: genetic modification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A genetic modification of the genome of an organism which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means. Examples of genetic modification include specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample processing
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Any aspects collected about the processing of the sample once it has been collected. if the sample underwent cell lysis.

FIELD.LABEL: protocol
FIELD.NAME: protocol
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The laboratory method used to reveal the presence of the sample sequenced in the experiment.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions imposed

FIELD.LABEL: environmental stress
FIELD.NAME: environmental stress
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental stress is a treatment where some aspect of the environment is perturbed in order to stress the organism or culture, e.g. change in temperature, change in watering regime.

FIELD.LABEL: environmental history
FIELD.NAME: environmental history
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information concerning the envinonrment a material entity has been exposed to, such as an organism from a lake.

FIELD.LABEL: growth condition
FIELD.NAME: growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A role that a material entity can play which enables particular conditions used to grow organisms or parts of the organism. This includes isolated environments such as cultures and open environments such as field studies.
